metadata.title: CVE-2023-46343 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.5.9, there is a NULL pointer dereference insend_acknowledge in net/nfc/nci/spi.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1118.128~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1123.130~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1122.131~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1065.70~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1117.126~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1102.114~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
